intro: Mapouria umbelluligera, commonly known as the white sand tree, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in sandy or coastal soils and thrives in tropical climates. It has a compact, shrub-like appearance with glossy, dark green leaves. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, although it is not widely known outside of its native range.
